chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Shawn Mitchell Smith was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
Defendant to set up a payment plan.

-Home Detention.
-Defendant to be supervised by Sun Monitoring, all expenses to be paid by Defendant and to sign up by 5:00 p.m. Friday May 13, 2016.
-Atty Kucinski must be notified right away and must submit proof to the Court within 10 days.
-Good time.
-Balance of 49 days left to serve.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

-Defendant not to leave residence for any reason except pre-approved medical appointments and other matters that have been approved by the Court.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Further random testing authorized and to be paid by Defendant.
-Any violations to be reported to the District Attorney's Office and the Court and Atty Kucinski will set a time for a hearing for violations and the Court may revoke Electronic Monitoring/Home Detention.
-Abide by any and all rules set forth by Sun Monitoring.

records.addlTxt:
Per RMW, Quash warrant and reinstate payment plan. hml
Faxed to Dispatch and Quash Sheriff. hml

DE called to inquire about missed pymt.  DE was advised that he has been issued a WA for non pymt & he may turn himself into the Jail, pay the bal in full, or make a $50 pymt (May & June pymt) to see if the Judge will quash WA based on his pymt.  DE was advised that his $50 pymt will not guarantee cancellation of his WA & it is solely up to the Judge.  DE stated he thought a friend was going to be making his pymts for him & that he never rec'd his Reminder Notice.  DE was advised that the Reminder Notices are considered a courtesy by the court & should not be relied upon to make pymt each mo.  DE stated he will submit a $50 pymt immediately.  jaf

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Shawn Mitchell Smith appeared. Case called at 8:43 a.m. Court notes this matter was originally set for a jury trial. Court received notice that there is a resolution. Atty Kucinski states there will be a plea to Ct. 1 and will argue recommendations.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct 1 OWI 3rd in 14CF256. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 OWI 3rd in 14CF256. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 2 & 3 in 14CF256. Sentencing arguments. Atty Kucinski calls Shawn Smith to testify. Direct by Atty Kucinski. DE Exhibit #1 (Letter from Dr. Stoy). DE Exhibit #2 ( x-ray photo) . O/R Exhibit #1 & #2. Cross by ADA Kucinski. Atty Kucinski gives recommendation. DE Exhibit #3 (re jail electronic monitoring). DE Exhibit #4 (Sun monitoring). Atty Kucinski files a proposed order regarding home detention. ADA McKinley gives sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal. Court will sign order for Option B with some modifications and a copy must be provided to Sun Monitoring. 

Crt orders:

On Count 1 OWI 3rd:

- Home detention for a period of 110 days. 34 days credit.

- DE to be supervised by Sun Montitoring. All expenses to be paid by DE. Sign up by 5 p.m. on Friday, May 13, 2016. Atty Kucinski must be notified right away and must submit proof to the court within 10 days.  
 Conditions are:
     - Do not leave residence for any reason except pre approved medical appointments and other matters that have been approved by the court.
     - Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times     while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
     - Further random testing authorized to be paid by DE
    - Any violations to be reported to DA's office, Court and Atty Kucinski at which time a hearing for violation will be set up and court may revoke electronic monitoring/home detention. 
    - Abide by any and all rules set forth by Sun Monitoring.  
  
- Fine of $3,214.00 inclusive of costs. To set up a payment plan. 

- AODA

- 30 month drivers license revocation

- 30 month IID
Fax from Atty Kucinski stating to remove the jury trial from the calendar. hml
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
to Grant Wis. Stat. 973.03(4)(a) Home Detention. Filed by Atty Kucinski. km
